body:
Oh we should just round it. I'll put in a fix

On Dec 13, 2012, at 1:20 PM, Craig Austin notifications@github.com wrote:

> from pandas import DataFrame
> df = DataFrame({'US': [1, 2]}, index=[datetime(2012,1,1), datetime(2012,1,2)])
> df.diff(1.)
> 
> This succeeded in 0.9.0. Now it raises:
> 
> pandas\core\frame.pyc in diff(self, periods)
> 3937 diffed : DataFrame
> 3938 """
> -> 3939 new_blocks = [b.diff(periods) for b in self._data.blocks]
> 3940 new_data = BlockManager(new_blocks, [self.columns, self.index])
> 3941 return self._constructor(new_data)
> 
> pandas\core\internals.pyc in diff(self, n)
> 292
> 293 def diff(self, n):
> --> 294 new_values = com.diff(self.values, n, axis=1)
> 295 return make_block(new_values, self.items, self.ref_items)
> 296
> 
> pandas\core\common.pyc in diff(arr, n, axis)
> 470 if arr.ndim == 2 and arr.dtype.name in _diff_special:
> 471 f = _diff_special[arr.dtype.name]
> --> 472 f(arr, out_arr, n, axis)
> 473 else:
> 474 res_indexer = [slice(None)] \* arr.ndim
> 
> pandas\algos.pyd in pandas.algos.diff_2d_int64 (pandas\algos.c:14030)()
> 
> TypeError: 'float' object cannot be interpreted as an index
> 
> This might very well be a desired change - but it's something we'll have to work around. I'm just reporting it for completeness :-)
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
n = int(n) in com.diff (and added test case)
